ygData.subject: Re: RE: Hope this isn't too OT..but
ygData.msgSnippet: The main things that affect zoning speed our ram and hard drive and somewhat on the connection. Yes processor speed does affect it but generally if you can
ygData.messageBody:
The main things that affect zoning speed our ram and hard drive and somewhat
on the connection. Yes processor speed does affect it but generally if you
can play the game that ins't your problem. I've got a extrmely fast hardrive
and 128mb of ram so I zone faster then most. I actually had 64 for awhile
and as soon as I popped another 64mb in my zoning speed was cut in half!

Naeeldar
-----Original Message-----
From: elaineec@... <elaineec@...>
To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, February 24, 2000 10:45 AM
Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] RE: Hope this isn't too OT..but


>From: elaineec@...
>
>Connection speed is definitely an issue when zoning but what about
processor
>speed? I am the first to admit I dont know much about computers, but a
group
>of friends and I play and we noticed the person with the slowest processor
>speed takes longest to zone. My friend who just got a new computer, faster
>than any of ours, now zones faster than any of us too.
>
>So my theory on why the boat waits so long after zoning to get moving again
>is: it's waiting for the person with the slowest computer or connection
speed
>on the boat to zone in.
>
>Whaddaya think? (Prolly I shouldn't oughta mess with computers huh?:)
>
>Lividity
>(who has developed quite a taste for fresh dwarf meat)
>Cazic-Thule
